hedline.hl1: Department Store Chain Gives Funds to Hospital

abstract.p: Kohl's department store chain donates $10,000 to Blythedale Children's Hospital in Valhalla, NY, and pledges more under its Kohl's Cares for Kids Program (S)

block.p: Kohl's, which opened four department stores in Westchester in April, has given $10,000 to Blythedale Children's Hospital in Valhalla and pledged to donate more under its Kohl's Cares for Kids program. The hospital will use the money to buy four pulse oximeters, which measure the amount of oxygen in the bloodstream without needles. Many infants in the hospital are on ventilators, and without the oximeters it is difficult to monitor how much air a baby is getting, said Maureen Desimone, vice president of the 92-bed hospital. Kohl's, based in Wisconsin, supports 35 children's hospitals across the country.
